brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to describe the safety and tolerability of two dose levels of
      OTO-201, placebo and sham when administered intra-operatively in pediatric subjects with
      bilateral middle ear effusion who require tympanostomy tube placement.

clinical_study.brief_title: OTO-201 for Middle Ear Effusion in Pediatric Subjects Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Placement
clinical_study.condition: Bilateral Middle Ear Effusion Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria includes, but is not limited to:

          -  Subject is a male or female aged 6 months to 12 years, inclusive

          -  Subject has a clinical diagnosis of bilateral middle ear effusion requiring
             tympanostomy tube placement

          -  Subject's caregiver is willing to comply with the protocol and attend all study
             visits

        Exclusion Criteria includes, but is not limited to:

          -  Subject has a history of prior ear or mastoid surgery, not including myringotomy or
             myringotomy with tympanostomy tube placement

          -  Subject has a history of sensorineural hearing loss

          -  Subject has a history of chronic or recurrent bacterial infections other than otitis
             media that likely will require treatment with antibiotics during the course of the
             study

facility.name: Call/Email Otonomy Central Contact for Trial Locations

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo- and Sham-Controlled, Multicenter, Phase 1b Study of OTO-201 Given as a Single Intratympanic Injection for Intra-Operative Treatment of Middle Ear Effusion in Pediatric Subjects Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Placement

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of adverse events, otoscopic exams, audiometry, and tympanometry

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of physician reported and caregiver reported otorrhea

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
